title: Update Oracle Drivers to Maven Central Version
Upgrade to  Apache POI 4.x
body:
I use dbUnit for setting up our integration tests from Excel and it works great.
Unfortunately we also use  POI for generating reports, so we are stuck with POI 3.7 when we want to use DbUnit and generating reports in the same VM.
So my request: please update POI to 4.x

title: Update code for Modernizer plugin violations
body:
Run mvn modernizer:modernizer (or the full build) to see the violations.

After updating all, enable failOnViolations.

title: org.apache.commons.dbcp.PoolingDataSource$PoolGuardConnectionWrapper cannot be cast to oracle.jdbc.OracleConnection
body:
Class org.dbunit.ext.oracle.OracleClobDataType uses deprecated class oracle.sql.CLOB for Clob entity initialization. Inner implementation of static method oracle.sql.CLOB.createTemporary(...) requires parameter Connection in type oracle.jdbc.OracleConnection (because it uses casting instead of unwrap() method ).
If wrapped OracleConnection is passed as parameter into createTemporary() method, then ClassCastException is thrown from Oracle driver - see attached stacktrace.

Fixed class contains non-deprecated approach of Clob entity initialization.

title: Add 'actual is null' and 'actual is not null' ValueComparers
body:
Allows comparing to simple null or not null.

Implemented as IsActualNullValueComparer and IsActualNotNullValueComparer.

title: Upgrade PostGIS JDBC driver to 2021.1.0
body:
dbUnit relies on old release of PostGIS JDBC driver, that has not been declared as a dependency; also an old version of the PostgrSQL driver is defined as an optional dependency

The PostGIS JDBC project released 2021.1.0 on Aug 5 of this year and has changed the package names to become properly modular, see https://github.com/postgis/postgis-java/releases/tag/v2021.1.0

dbUnit should use the new `net.postgis.PGgeometry`

title: Create Support for MariaDB
body:
I'm getting this annoying warning...

18:10:14  WARN | o.d.d.AbstractTableMetaData                             | Potential problem found: The configured data type factory 'class org.dbunit.ext.mysql.MySqlDataTypeFactory' might cause problems with the current database 'MariaDB' (e.g. some datatypes may not be supported properly). In rare cases you might see this message because the list of supported database products is incomplete (list=[mysql]). If so please request a java-class update via the forums.If you are using your own IDataTypeFactory extending DefaultDataTypeFactory, ensure that you override getValidDbProducts() to specify the supported database products. 

In theory, MariaDB should be compatible with MySQL, so implementation should be straightforward... Also maybe add it to the supported list...

**In rare cases you might see this message because the list of supported database products is incomplete (list=[mysql])** 

I know it is extremely low priority but I checked for Feature requests and it seems no one asked for it yet... so...

title: Make connection properties configurable for DataSourceDatabaseTester
Big-Bang-Update Dependencies to current versions
body:
I suggest to update all dependencies so that the library smoothly integrates with current versions of 
* Java
* JakartaEE
* Spring

title: FlatXmlWriter doesn't export LocalDateTime value properly
body:
FlatXmlWriter uses the toString() method to write the values from the IDataSet to the XML output. When timestamp values are retrieved as LocalDateTime (and probably other classes from java. time) by the JDBC driver, then the generated format is not readable by DbUnit later. LocalDateTime.toString() generates e.g. 2024-01-29T21:49:48+01:00, but DbUnit doesn't recognize the T, nor the appended time zone. 

Either the output of FlatXmlWriter should be changed, or the parsing of the XML values should be adjusted.

title: Replace maven parent
body:
The oss-parent pom is over 10 years old. Some of the dependencies have vulnerabilities, and the repository has been archived since Aug 10, 2020 (see https://github.com/sonatype/oss-parents/blob/master/README.md)

The author's recommendation is to "manage parent POM files from your own organization as needed. The POM files from this project no longer work with latest Maven and/or Java versions." 

I believe rest-assured has already encountered an issue with upcoming maven4 release (https://github.com/rest-assured/rest-assured/issues/1754).

I believe we could setup a dbunit-parent pom as a replacement, to manage the versions that 'oss-parents' used to manage for us.

title: Bump postgresqldriver version to 42.3.10
body:
Postgresqldriver, aka pgjdbc, has a few critical vulnerabilities in the version pulled in the pom.xml file. Currently version 42.3.1 is defined. Please bump the version to 42.3.10 so as to have less vulnerable transitive dependencies when using dbUnit. 

Some of the vulnerabilities brought in by version 42.3.1 include: 
* https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2024-1597
* https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2022-21724
* https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2022-26520

title: Configure Maven Wrapper mvnw
body: For consistent build version.

title: Make it easier to run ITs with one or all databases in local build
body:
The current setup is a hindrance to easily verify changes.
Update build to automatically start and stop databases for ITs.

Update CI builds as needed to adjust.

title: Migrate from GitLab to GitHub for CI
body: GitLab has too many missing features and limitations.  400 mins per month, no service start timeout feature, and kills Oracle on startup.

title: DefaultPrepAndExpectedTestCase: lower log levels
body:
Lower warn level to info or debug.
Review info and debug levels for lowering.

title: assertEquals(ITable, ITable) don't work
body:
The DataSetUtils.AssertEquals\(ITable, ITable\) do not 
work correctly.

title: Identifiers are case sensitive
body:
Identifiers in the dataset XML file are treated as 
case-sensitive, even if the database is case-
insensitive.

If the database returns the table name as &quot;COMPANY&quot; 
and the dataset uses &quot;Company&quot;, DbUnit will throw a 
NoSuchTableException.  The same basic problem occurs 
with column names.

If DbUnit can't be modified to be smart about case-
insensitive databases, it would be nice to at least 
point this out in the documentation.  It took me quite 
a while to understand why my table names weren't being 
recognized.

title: All columns are part of primary key
body:
This bug has been submitted in the dbunit-user 
mailling list:

I have a table where the primary key includes all 
columns

This generates an SQL exception when doing a refresh 
operation because of a generated  update statement 
looking like:

&quot;update FOO.BAR set where A=1 and B=2 and C=3&quot;


Guillaume

title: Null Values FlatXmlDataSet
body:
Message: 8284985 
FROM: Brian BrooksDATE: 04/03/2002 11:54:37SUBJECT:  
\[dbunit-user\] Null Values Syntax FlatXmlDataSet 
junit.framework.AssertionFailedError: column count 
\(table=SERVICE\) expected:&lt;2&gt; but was:&lt;4&gt;

With Dbunit 1.2.4, what is the FlatXmlDataSet syntax 
for columns containing NULL values?

I'm trying to use the FlatXmlDataSet like

// Fetch database data after executing your code 
String\[\] tableNames = \{&quot;SERVICE&quot;\};
IDatabaseConnection connection = getConnection\(\);
IDataSet partialDataSet = 
connection.createDataSet\(tableNames\);
ITable databaseData = 
partialDataSet.getTable\(&quot;SERVICE&quot;\);

// Load expected data from an xml dataset
IDataSet expectedDataSet = new FlatXmlDataSet\( 
new FileInputStream\(&quot;expectedDataSetService.xml&quot;\) \);
ITable expectedData = 
expectedDataSet.getTable\(&quot;SERVICE&quot;\);

// Verify if database data match expected data
DataSetUtils.assertEquals\(expectedData, databaseData\);

There are several entries in the SERVICE table that 
correctly contain NULL values.  However, I can't 
figure out the correct syntax for the 
FlatXmlDataSet .xml file.

Right now when I try the syntax from the extract,

&lt;dataset&gt;
&lt;SERVICE CUSTOMERID='1000' SERVICECODE='PCEW'/&gt;
&lt;SERVICE CUSTOMERID='1000' SERVICECODE='PSW'/&gt;
&lt;SERVICE CUSTOMERID='1000' OPERATORID='DG1' 
SERVICECODE='GMTS' SUBSERVICE='APP'/&gt;
&lt;SERVICE CUSTOMERID='1000' OPERATORID='DG1'
SERVICECODE='GMTS' SUBSERVICE='REL'/&gt;
&lt;SERVICE CUSTOMERID='1000' OPERATORID='DG1'
SERVICECODE='GMTS' SUBSERVICE='APP'/&gt;  
&lt;/dataset&gt;

Note that for the first and second row, I want to 
express that the OPERATORID and SUBSERVICE columns 
contain NULL values.

When I try to use this syntax to indicate these 
entries contain NULL values, I get this error

junit.framework.AssertionFailedError: column count
\(table=SERVICE\) expected:&lt;2&gt; but was:&lt;4&gt;
at org.dbunit.dataset.DataSetUtils.assertEquals
\(DataSetUtils.java:114\)
at mytest.testBillyBob\(mytest.java:55\)

which seems to indicate that the assertEquals needs a 
more explicit statement that the OPERATORID and 
SUBSERVICE columns for the first and second rows 
contain NULL values.

Message: 8286691
FROM: Manuel LaflammeDATE: 04/03/2002 14:33:57SUBJECT: 
RE:  \[dbunit-user\] Null Values Syntax The problem is 
that the current implementation uses the first table 
row to
generate the table metadata. Ideally DbUnit should use 
metadata from the DTD
if one exists.
Please log this problem in the bug database. As a 
temporary workaround, you
need to provide the first row without null values or 
to use the XmlDataSet
class.
Manuel Laflamme, Software Architect
Freeborders Canada

Finally, for some reason on my home computer the 
behavior has changed slightly, I get this trace
org.dbunit.dataset.NoSuchColumnException:
&lt;OPERATORID&gt; not a column of table &lt;SERVICE&gt;
at org.dbunit.dataset.AbstractTable.assertValidColumn
\(AbstractTable.java:51\)
at org.dbunit.dataset.xml.FlatXmlTable.getValue
\(FlatXmlTable.java:94\)
at org.dbunit.operation.AbstractBatchOperation.
execute\(AbstractBatchOperation.java:93\)
at org.dbunit.operation.CompositeOperation.
execute\(CompositeOperation.java:68\)
at org.dbunit.DatabaseTestCase.executeOperation
\(DatabaseTestCase.java:84\)
at org.dbunit.DatabaseTestCase.setUp
\(DatabaseTestCase.java:101\)
at mytest.main\(mytest.java:21\)

title: Assertion.assertEquals() table names
body:
On line 67 of Assertion.java \(CVS version 1.3, Mar 22, 2002\), in the function
Assertion.assertEquals\(IDataSet expectedDataSet, IDataSet actualDataSet\)
it should read:

if \(actualNames\[i\].equals\(expectedNames\[i\]\) == false\)

instead of

if \(actualNames\[i\].equals\(expectedNames\[i\]\)\)

otherwise an error will be returned if the table names are
the same, instead of when they are different.

title: clearParameters() problem with oracle 8i
body:
From: Jeremy\_Stein@elementk.com
Sent: Wednesday, April 10, 2002 2:10 PM
To: dbunit-user@lists.sourceforge.net
Subject: \[dbunit-user\] clearParameters on batch 
statement causing error withOracle
\----

Is it necessary for PreparedBatchStatement.clearBatch 
to call
\_statement.clearParameters\(\)?  I'm using Oracle 8i, 
and the thin driver is
giving me an internal error:

java.sql.SQLException: internal error
at 
oracle.jdbc.dbaccess.DBError.throwSqlException
\(DBError.java:114\)
at 
oracle.jdbc.dbaccess.DBError.throwSqlException
\(DBError.java:156\)
at 
oracle.jdbc.dbaccess.DBError.throwSqlException
\(DBError.java:219\)
at oracle.jdbc.dbaccess.DBDataSet.setDBItem
\(DBDataSet.java:310\)
at
oracle.jdbc.driver.OraclePreparedStatement.clearParamet
ers\(OraclePreparedStatement.java:2502\)
at
org.dbunit.database.statement.PreparedBatchStatement.cl
earBatch\(PreparedBatchStatement.java:74\)
at
org.dbunit.operation.RefreshOperation.executeRowOperati
on\(RefreshOperation.java:126\)
at
org.dbunit.operation.RefreshOperation.execute
\(RefreshOperation.java:183\)

If I comment out that line, it seems to work fine... 
but am I breaking
something else?

\(For reference, I've appended an easy way to reproduce 
the error without
using DbUnit.\)

Thank you\!

Jeremy


\-------------------------------------------------------
\---------------
import java.sql.\*;

public class Test \{

public static void main\(String\[\] args\) \{
try \{
Class.forName
\(&quot;oracle.jdbc.driver.OracleDriver&quot;\);
Connection conn = DriverManager.getConnection\(
&quot;jdbc:oracle:thin:@server:1521:db&quot;, &quot;user&quot;,
&quot;pwd&quot;\);
PreparedStatement pstmt = 
conn.prepareStatement\(
&quot;update ORGANIZATION set ORG\_NAME = ? 
where ORG\_ID = ?&quot;\);
pstmt.setString\(1, &quot;Org Name&quot;\);
pstmt.setInt\(2, 123\);
pstmt.addBatch\(\);
pstmt.executeBatch\(\);
pstmt.clearParameters\(\);
\}
catch \(Exception e\) \{
e.printStackTrace\(System.err\);
\}
\}
\}
\-------------------------------------------------------
\---------------

title: Delete should use reverse row order
